metadata.title: CVE-2018-16430 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
GNU Libextractor through 1.7 has an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in EXTRACTOR_zip_extract_method() in zip_extractor.c. It was discovered that Libextractor incorrectly handled certain specially crafted files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-16430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

extract - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-archive - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-av - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-exiv2 - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-flac - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-gif - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-gstreamer - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-html - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-jpeg - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-midi - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-mpeg - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-ogg - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-ole2 - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-pdf - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-rpm - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-thumbnailgtk - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugin-tiff - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugins-all - 1:1.7-1
libextractor-plugins-misc - 1:1.7-1
libextractor3 - 1:1.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libextractor package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.7-1').
